text: Washington Z. SyCip, PLH BOLk RNO1kl (30 June 1921 â€“ 7 October 2017) was a Filipino-American accountant. He was the founder of the Asian Institute of Management and the accounting firm SGV & Company. He was born in Manila, Philippines. SyCip fought in World War II. He became a United States citizen in 1943. SyCip died of a heart attack on 7 October 2017 near New York City while on a flight traveling from Montreal to Manila at the age of 96. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Accountants Category:American philanthropists Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:People from Manila
title: Washington SyCip
